description: Much better appearance than the notes application I was using before. Like the previous application, the regular saving feature seems to make saving unnecessary (not sure whether this should be relied on though).
summary: Very good, easy to use for quick or more permanent notes

description: It's always annoying to read other reviews which complain that it doesn't have the features they think it should have. Not every app should have every feature that every user suggests. This is the best hierarchical notes app for Linux I've found, although it's a bit slow (it's in Python) and formatting text is a little awkward (e.g. heading case applied only after typing). Full set of features. Recommended.
summary: Best of its kind on Linux

description: It's very practical and exporting textes to .pdf and to .txt is reallyhelpful.
Very flexible, lightweight
The ability to open an inserted file has stopped working for me which was one of the core reasons i decided to go with cherry tree over other applications. Please update ;(

I had just gotten into this app and loved it then I upgraded to Ubuntu 20.4 and it seems to have lost the ability to access external drives. Like they don't even show up in the file window and if you double click the file in the drive it won't run but it will if you move it to the hard drive. I have had problem with this program crashing and loosing stuff in previous versions so I probably will just switch to something else, I love the app but I can;t trust it to run. Ubuntu on installation removed cherrytree for some reason so that also is telling me something. Actually is said cherrytree was obsolete.

When you pick Edit> Preferences> Rich Text and change the settings iyou get a table of sombody's favorite movies? When you pull up a personal file and then change any setting in Rich text, the text in the first file you highlighted appears in duplicate on every file and folder on the tree. 
This is a sweet app. I've been using this for years, and I have a lot of important files. Cherrytree has worked fine until they turned it into this Snap.
summary: "Rich Text" in the preferences menu breaks Cherrytree

description:
Excellent simple to use tool for taking notes. Currently 
use it to enter command for all my installed 
software like postgres 12, MariaDB, python3, 
django etc. Its great to be able to do this for each 
sub topic. Will download this for my Windows machine
as well.
summary: Best tool I used on Lubunti

description: awsome tool for day to day note keeping
So far has been very usefull. Just if it could be easier to change the icons
summary: I use in everyday I love it

description: After writing print command is not functionable

I've used Cherrytree for years, and I am extremely happy with this app, but not the snap. The snap inhibits customization by giving every folder and file identical text, just for changing Preferences. So I have to uinstall and reinstall until I find the preferences the snap prefrers. What's wrong with this picture?
summary: This is a great app but..

description: I really like it. You can save your notes in XML files or a SQLite database. The notes are hierarchical which is nice for organzing. It's also extremely customizable.
summary: Great for journaling and note taking

description:
Fresh install of Ubuntu 2020.04. 
Cherrytree had worked when first installed.
Finished installing of all software and testing apps.
Cherrytree would only show squares for all text on screen. Font broken.
Uninstalled, cleaned, purged and reinstalled. No avail. Still font broken.
Had to use .deb from author.
.deb has version 0.99.0 not the 0.39.3 on snap
.deb worked when snap failed

I have been using it for years and I loved it. Then some insane guy at Ubuntu decided that it would be great to break the whol Python2 support in the new release. CherryTree is now impossible to install without a million hacks because there are no packages available for Ubuntu 20.04. It's a complete pitfall.
this app is amazing and i use it all the time/ recommeded
summary: Amazing app i use it daily

description:
I really liked the detailed customization options and good documentation of cherrytree. Lots of options provide flexibility, for example I tried zim and I didn't find it as flexible. You can create a complex hierarchy of notes with much ease. 
Has a lot of options like links between nodes (notes) which I really liked. Definitely check out the documentation and the detailed preferences section. Goes well with the dark theme if you set the color preferences right.
summary: Great app, I am using it to replace OneNote/EverNote

description:
This application has helped to bring together many daily notes on various categories in a structured and organised way. Better than many text based note taking applications. Very useful. 
Hope it will continue and the development will not be abandoned.

The snap version will not print, unless I save to PDF, then print the PDF file. I deleted the snap version, and installed the DEB version, and that prints fine. Cherrytree is the best Ubuntu note taking app.
Slick interface, simple use, a perfect tool.

I found this app Awesome!
Thanks!

OK, I've been using Cherry for about 4 years. It's best app for notetaking, much better that OneNote. You can edit every bit of its interface (e.g. font in the "tree", or tool panels, which are easy hidable) and you can use notkeys for almost every task you do.
BUT Cherry is not so good on Ubuntu 20.04: You cannot open embedded files, edit them and then save it without reattaching, and it's pain in the ass! Preferences you choose are saved from time to time, not on a constant basis! These two bugs make Cherry much worse that it has to be.
summary: Great app, but it's not perfect on Ubuntu 20.04.01 LTS

description:
I would give 5 stars if I could keep my source notes after importing into CherryTree. I mean, after importing my text file as note (node) in CherryTree I can change it but the changes don't go to the source file but only to CherryTree repository.
I understand that its repository gives us securiry but I would like to choose to keep my files where they acutally are and sync them.
I know there is the link option but it's not the same when you import the folder or the note itself.
Any way, it's something to be implemented but the idea is really great and I'll keep the software installed expecting that one day this feature is gonna come.
summary: Don't keep your text files updated but uses just its own repository

description: Sadly this app doesn't work at all in VirtualBox under Ubuntu 20.10.
I am a pentester, i organize all my notes with CherryTree, love it!

Very good except for all export things, expect to be trapped, but this is a good trap, quality is here.
The other choice on linux is Zim, very good too, better for export in html but cherryTree is better for text formating.

OS: Ubuntu 20.04 LTS

I updated to version .99 and it seems really buggy? 
-Changing the Tree Node background doesnt change
-I just opened a .ctz and it let me right in without prompting for a password
-If you have one CherryTree doc open, and right click "Open New Document" from the task bar, it open the last most recent doc (even though that option is turned off and the most recent doc was closed)

Not sure if this is where we report bugs, but I love the program and unfirtunately have to revert back to the old version in order for it to work properly. All in all its a great tool, not sure how I made it through life with out it!
thank you so much for it
great software ... recommend it...
We can even saves notes with password protected
summary: Superb App to take notes better

description: Top note taking (and keeping...) application.

I am having a problem launching the app...
PS: I installed using command line "Snap install cherrytree"
summary: I think it is a great app which made me to download it

description: This is my favourite note taking application. I've been using it for a few years now, and it works like a charm.
This is best for note taking by design.
the best , it's help me !
how can i input chinese in cherrytree?
Nice app default for editing

This commands rich application has been around for a while and I have tried to make it an application I can use. I have been an avid user of such applications. Yet, I can never get use to this particular one. What I have noticed is that the developer has thrown all kinds of options and commands that are really not needed for a functional application of this kind. Many of these features also get in your way. The developer has also left out the required integration with the web. It has all the making of a
useful, powerful, dependable application, but needs some king or 
organizational make over. I hope to one day see such usability.
summary: Features for features' sake does not a usable application make

description: New features keep surprising me, does all I need and more!

I use it for 3 years now. It works for Linux and Windoos. 
Sadly not native available on Mac, so I looked around for others. None comes close in ease and scope.
It is a dream to use. I use it as a central hub to acces all kinds of info or to start external programs.
Great for people preparing a doctoral thesis.
I Just loved it because of its quality over open source. :D

I'm a huge fan of cherrytree, been using it for years and recommend it often to co-workers. This is a fantastic OneNote alternative with much more clear control over your data and privacy and a few capabilities you won't find in the big-box "Give up your privacy, trust us, we'll never leak your corporate data" competitors. You can password protect the sqlite db, offline it to a thumbdrive or synchronize it with other machines using your chosen sync app and BAM, your notes are available on all of your Windows or Linux machines.
summary: Been using it for years, can't live without it now

description:
Its tree-structure and rich text integration, among many other features, make it very easy for me to take notes and arrange the material in a pleasant and, most importantly, effective manner. 
Highly recommended.
summary: Best app I know for taking notes

description: After having used and fiddled around with various note-taking apps--Obsidian, Gnote, Evernote, etc.--I have come to love this one for its structure, simplicity, and functionality. For this, I am truly grateful for the developers who made this possible for me to have an excellent system for gathering information to improve my knowledge.
summary: Jettisoned All Other Note-taking Apps for This One

description:
This application is set up in a tree note outline format and it spends a lot of menus on how to adjust the nodes and its arrangements. It also allows you to import and export several document types such as html and pdf. It also spends a lot of its functionalities around formatting text entries. 
The problem is that you can not do much with these types of functionalities because they don’t deal with producing manageable documents. It is a text bound application for text sake. It lacks a real modern functionality that can allows the user to connect to the repository of written information – the internet. The lack of web based functionality of this application has always been its main weakness.
Ok, it allows you to write a url link to a website, but when you click on it, it does nothing, It only allows you to edit the link entry. And this is just pitiful. This application has stayed stuck in time and it needs to have modern writing functionalities. If you like to work with text and you think wrestling with text is written communication productivity then this app is for you. Otherwise, it needs a functionality enema.
summary: Nodes for nodes' sake; text entry for text entry sake

description: i have been using it for more than 2 years, works awesome and I really loved it

Perfect for everyday usage and making notes. 

Note: the flathub.org package is not able to forward embedded files to external programs (e.g. office document to libreoffice). Usually you can store e.g. a document in cherrytree and open this by double click via e.g. libreoffice.
Es la mejor aplicación para llevar notas, la uso ya varios años, quizá unos 8 años y no la cambio por nada

Estoy muy contento con esta aplicación, la utilizo para todo menos para guardar contraseñas. Me ayuda a tener mis anotaciones sobre lo que estudio de programación muy bien estructuruado, por secciones gracias a la posibilidad de añadir hijos. 

Conocí esta herramienta cuando migre de windows a linux y descubri que no había una versión para linux de la herramienta TreePad.

La recomiendo al 100%,
summary: Magnífica herramienta para estructurar tus anotaciones

description: Muy buena cumple con todo los requisitos 100 % recomendada
Mise à jour impossible vers cherrytree-0.39.2-1.noarch.rpm, ça me dit "Une mauviase signature GPG a été trouvée".

Impossible de naviguer dans l'arborescence !
Merci de tester COMPLÈTEMENT les versions avant la mise en production.
Je me sers de CherryTree depuis le début (2009).

Merci au développeur. Après avoir testé presque toutes les applis de ce genre. C'est pour mon utilisation la meilleure.

J'attends une version .deb avec impatience, je ne suis pas fan des snap.

Merci.

Une excellente application de note hiérarchisée, simple et complète. 
Alors pourquoi n'est t-elle proposée qu'en snap avec les limitations liées à ce format (impossible d’accéder aux disques réseaux) . de plus , le fichier DEB proposé sur le site de l'auteur ne semble plus fonctionner avec la version 20.04. 
donc 2 étoiles parceque c'est un snap, sinon 5

Logiciel presque sans aucun défaut,ce qui est très rare,d'après mon expérience utilisateur.
*J'apprécie plus particulièrement:
la copie de pages web,presque parfaite,avec seulement,quelques détails de mise en page a revoir,parfois...
*La conservation des liens initiaux web,lors de la copie !
*La possibilité de réaffecter ces lien a l'intérieur des notes personnelles !
NOTA:j'ai a plusieurs reprises eu besoin d'une fonction particulière,et j'ai chaque fois découvert que cette fonction était incuse !
*seul défaut:il faut absolument prendre la précaution d'enregistrer son travail régulièrement,sans quoi on s'expose a des pertes de travail,mais c'est peu contraignant,au final,et ça marche!
summary: Difficile de trouver mieux et plus intelligent

description:
Cheery Tree est surtout interessant pour les porjets ou notes sur le long terme -> une sorte de hierarchisatiopn de README ou l'onpeut aussi bien copier des extraits de trucs de forms que rédiger avec mise en page assez complexe etc.
Un conseil : ne pas multiplier les fichiers mais plutot les noeuds . Exemple j'ai un fichier "Trucs_Infos.ctb" Qui regroupe toutes les astuces , hiérarchisées par logiciel ou theme.
summary: Astucieux et original pour gérer notes, projets

description: parfait pour la prise de notes
Хранение	данных в одном файле — очень удобно. Легко копировать, можно взять с собой на флешке.

Про темную тему системы можно забыть сразу. Текст практически сливается с фоном. В режиме автоматической подсветки синтаксиса цвета подобраны странно, тоже практически ничего не разобрать. Под Linux пользоваться не просто. Под виндой таких проблем нет. Хочется, чтобы авторы обратили на это внимание, т.к. с мультиплатформенными альтернативами пока туго.
В снап-пакет завернуто, долго открывается.

Древовидная структура, возможность использовать форматировонный текст, подсветку синтаксиса. 
Не хватает только приложения под андроид.
summary: Лучший на мой взгляд менеджер заметок
